alert.note: Alert for McCurtain (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 02 at 11:06PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern McCurtain County through 1145 PM CDT... At 1105 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Nashoba, or 11 miles southeast of Clayton, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Smithville, Watson, Bethel, Battiest, Pickens, Ringold, Mount Herman and Sherwood. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for southeastern Oklahoma.
